jsl.utilities.statistic
Class AbstractCollector

java.lang.Object
  jsl.utilities.statistic.AbstractCollector
All Implemented Interfaces:
IdentityIfc, CollectorIfc, SaveDataIfc
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractStatistic, ExceedanceEstimator, WeightedStatistic
public abstract class AbstractCollector
extends java.lang.Object
implements CollectorIfc, SaveDataIfc

An abstract base class for building sub-classes that implement the CollectorIfc

Author:
rossetti
 

Field Summary
protected  double[] myData
          The array to collect the data if the saved flag is true If the statistic is reset and data was saved, this array should be cleared (as if no data had been collected).
protected  int myDataArraySize
          Used to set the array size increment when the collect data option is turned on

          A flag to indicate whether or not the statistic should save the data as it is collected.

          The weights associated with each saved data point

Field Detail

myIdCounter_

private static long myIdCounter_
A counter to count the number of created to assign "unique" ids

myId

protected long myId
The id of this object

myName

protected java.lang.String myName
Holds the name of the statistic for reporting purposes.

myData

protected double[] myData
The array to collect the data if the saved flag is true If the statistic is reset and data was saved, this array should be cleared (as if no data had been collected). Sub-classes should use the protected method clearSavedData() within their implementations of the abstract reset() method

myDataArraySize

protected int myDataArraySize
Used to set the array size increment when the collect data option is turned on

mySaveCount

protected int mySaveCount
Counts the number of data points that were saved to the save array

mySaveDataFlag

protected boolean mySaveDataFlag
A flag to indicate whether or not the statistic should save the data as it is collected. Sub-classes should use the protected method saveData(double x) to store the data within their implementations of the abstract collect() method if this flag is true, the data should start to be saved.

myWeights

protected double[] myWeights
The weights associated with each saved data point

setSaveDataArraySizeIncrement

public void setSaveDataArraySizeIncrement(int n)
Description copied from interface: SaveDataIfc
Controls the amount that the saved data array will grow by after it has been filled up. If the potential number of data points is known, then this method can be used so that arrays do not have to be copied during collection The array size will start at this value and then increment by this value whenever full

Specified by:
setSaveDataArraySizeIncrement in interface SaveDataIfc

setSaveDataOption

public void setSaveDataOption(boolean flag)
Description copied from interface: SaveDataIfc
Sets the save data option true = on, false = off If true, the data will be saved to an array If this option is toggled, then only the data when the option is true will be saved.

Specified by:
setSaveDataOption in interface SaveDataIfc
